name: SCTK single-cell typing with singleR
description: singleR, made available through the single-cell toolkit (SCTK) allows annotation of cells based on canonical transcription markers. Further information is available at https://www.nature.com/articles/s41590-018-0276-y

SctkSingler.exprs_file.description: The input matrix- a raw (not normalized) gene expression matrix for your single-cell RNA-seq experiment.
SctkSingler.exprs_file.name: Input matrix:

SctkSingler.annotation_level.description: The level of annotation for the cell typing. Choose "main" for broad annotation of major cell types. Fine-grained typing defines more subtypes, but is naturally slower and more prone to misidentification.
SctkSingler.annotation_level.name: Annotation level:

SctkSingler.reference.description: The reference annotation to which we will compare your cells. For more information see https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.17/data/experiment/vignettes/celldex/inst/doc/userguide.html
SctkSingler.reference.name: Reference database:

SctkSingler.identifier_choice.description: Which gene identifiers are used in your expression matrix? Symbols correspond with common gene names while Ensembl identifiers start with ENSG.
SctkSingler.identifier_choice.name: Gene identifier:
